name: proconio-zig
description: proconio for the Zig programming language. useful and easy io library for programming contests.

releases.name: v0.3.0
releases.body:
The third release of proconio-zig. This release compatible with Zig v0.15.1.

## What's Changed
* Update for Zig 0.15.1 (https://github.com/Ryoga-exe/proconio-zig/pull/4)


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Ryoga-exe/proconio-zig/compare/v0.2.0...v0.3.0

releases.name: v0.2.0
v0.1.0
releases.body:
The first release of `proconio-zig`.

## Added

- `proconio.init`
  - Returns a `Proconio` instance that provides an easy way to read values from stdin.
- `proconio.initInteractive`
  - An interactive version of `proconio.init`.
  - The normal `proconio.init` reads the entire input at once in judge environment to optimize I/O performance. However this does not work well with interactive probrems.
- `proconio.ProconioAny`
  - It has `deinit` and `input` method to handle input and memory management.

### Supported types for `input`:

| Type      | Support | Notes |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| `void`    | ‚úÖ      | Ignored input token |
| `int`     | ‚úÖ      | Parsed using `std.fmt.parseInt` with `base = 0` |
| `float`   | ‚úÖ      | Parsed using `std.fmt.parseFloat` |
| `bool`    | ‚úÖ      | Custom conversion function can be overridden |
| `enum`    | ‚úÖ      | If a number is provided, it attempts to convert it to an enum value |
| `array`   | ‚úÖ      | ‚Äî |
| `optional`| ‚úÖ      | If parsing fails, the value is set to `null` |
| `vector`  | ‚úÖ      | ‚Äî |
| `struct`  | üü°      | Partial support |
| `pointer` | ‚ùå      | Not supported |

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/Ryoga-exe/proconio-zig/commits/v0.1.0
